description:
# Reading Data from Files

So far, all data disappears when your program ends. Learn to read from files to load persistent data!

## Reading Text Files

```python
# Method 1: Using with (recommended)
with open("quest_log.txt", "r") as file:
    content = file.read()  # Read entire file
    print(content)

# File automatically closes after 'with' block
```

## Reading Line by Line

```python
# Read all lines into a list
with open("items.txt", "r") as file:
    lines = file.readlines()
    for line in lines:
        print(line.strip())  # .strip() removes \n

# Better: iterate directly
with open("items.txt", "r") as file:
    for line in file:
        print(line.strip())
```

## Parsing Data

```python
# If file contains: "Sword,100,weapon"
with open("inventory.txt", "r") as file:
    for line in file:
        name, value, item_type = line.strip().split(",")
        print(f"{name} is worth {value} gold")
```

# Quest Log Reader

# Sample data (simulating file content)
quest_data = '''Defeat the Goblin King,Completed,500
Find the Lost Artifact,In Progress,1000
Rescue the Village,Completed,300
Explore the Dark Cave,Not Started,750
Defeat the Dragon,Completed,2000'''

# Simulate reading from a file
lines = quest_data.split('\n')

print("=== ALL QUESTS ===")
for line in lines:
    parts = line.split(",")
    quest_name = parts[0]
    status = parts[1]
    reward = int(parts[2])
    
    print(f"{quest_name}: {status} - {reward}g")

print("\n=== COMPLETED QUESTS ===")
total_rewards = 0

for line in lines:
    parts = line.split(",")
    quest_name = parts[0]
    status = parts[1]
    reward = int(parts[2])
    
    if status == "Completed":
        print(f"✓ {quest_name} - Earned {reward}g")
        total_rewards += reward

print(f"\nTotal rewards earned: {total_rewards}g")

print("\n=== QUEST STATISTICS ===")
total_quests = len(lines)
completed_count = 0

for line in lines:
    parts = line.split(",")
    if parts[1] == "Completed":
        completed_count += 1

completion_rate = (completed_count / total_quests) * 100
print(f"Quests completed: {completed_count}/{total_quests}")
print(f"Completion rate: {completion_rate:.1f}%")
hints: Use line.split(',') to split by commas
